description: I've come here twice. The selection is quite the usual. The service is efficient because they make you write down your order on a piece of paper. It's usually quick and great for an in between class meal. My only complaint is that the spicy mayo, was NOT spicy at all. Other than that, the prices were pretty good even after extra avocado. I'd come back if I was in the area and hungry.
author: Eishlee J.

description: This is my second visit to this poke place and I liked my experience this time around, so I might as well write a review of this hidden poke place for the SFSU students and  Lake Merced Apartments who love right by here in this small shopping plaza, right off the start of 280 freeway. I felt the ingredients were much better and they have tofu as free topping! I don't see tofu as a common topping. There's always seem to one lady working there. The free yelp check in for miso soup was a little on salty side but it did have chunks of tofu and seaweed inside this time around. Last time it didn't have much ingredients. It's a very laid back and easy going tiny environment. I pretty much ordered tuna and salmon with ginger sauce which was really tasty and I just loaded it with toppings I would enjoy. It made me full, so it was good and I was well fed. Yummy in my tummy.
author: Priscilla L.

description: Meh.  Tuna had a "fishy" smell.  I was the only one in the place, yet still required to fill out the paper slip for my order. Lol
author: Eric N.

description: I had the salmon bowl and I thought it was pretty good. I'm usually not a raw seafood eater. I also had the honey dew add on. Very good I thought that the place was pretty good for a small but yet well presented
author: Selby C.

description: The food is nothing special, they also ran out of bay scallops when I got there around 5pm. The only people in the shop was the Asian employee girl with glasses and her friends?! All she did was sat in the area talking to her friends really loud and they took up 2/3 of the space which was super annoying. Their miso soup was also bland and tasteless
author: Irene Z.

description:
After hiking in North Bay, we were craving poke and found this spot. It's a quaint, little shop with only three tables with some fake plants. To order, you grab a sheet on your left as you enter. It's pretty straight forward with steps to choose your size, base, protein, sauce, sides, and toppings. It made it easy to order without the pressure of standing in front of the server choosing what you wanted, so I liked that. I ordered the large bowl ($12.50) with almost every topping. I do like that there's so many add-ons here. Despite that, I was quite disappointed from the poke bowl. There was hardly any sauce in my fish despite choosing heavy. I even had to ask for extra ponzu sauce on the side, but didn't make much difference. So if you're looking for plain raw fish, here you go. The rice was also pretty hard, which could've helped if there was more sauce infused into it.

Tip: Free miso soup with a Yelp check-in, although the miso soup was a bit watered down.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
First, this place is very small and cute. It only seats about 7 people, so it's not exactly a place to bring a whole crowd. My friends and I went on a Saturday evening and only a handful of others popped in and out during our time there.

You order by filling out the order form located next to the door. It's pretty easy to miss! My friends and I felt like we were taking a multiple choice due to its setup, but the information is laid out well.

I got a small poke salad bowl. The flavors of each topping chosen seemed to remain distinct rather than blend together, which was weird to me. Maybe I didn't have enough dressing, but it tasted more like a regular salad but with poke tossed in as protein.

The portion was filling enough to keep my tummy satisfied and the value for what I paid was good. Worth trying if you need a light meal.
author: Karen T.

description:
Really gone downhill

I've eaten here twice before and it was OK, but things have gotten bad.

The store seems to have major inventory issues.  

While not a major issue, 1/3 of the proteins were "sold out" less than 1 hour after opening, as well as several of the popular toppings.

The tuna that did remain was very gristly and the some of the vegetables had seen better days.

The employee did her best to make us bowls out of to go containers for eating in store putting the toppings on one side and the rice on the other and ripped them apart.  She made a good effort, but ...

Please bring the level back up to what it was.
author: Christian M.

description: Seriously great little Poke spot! I think this is the hidden gem of the Cambon Market, with super fresh ingredients, friendly service every time, and reasonable prices.  I love the modern decor, the drink selections, and their rice is always cooked perfectly. Furthermore, I think their packaging is biodegradable, which is a really nice touch-- would like to see more restaurants adopting this as a standard! If you're in the Cambon market, you should definitely give this place a try.
author: Virginia J.

description:
The food is fresh and delicious, but the service is soso. I like the environment that is very relaxing and nice. 
I ordered a regular size, but I should have order a small one since I could not finish a regular size. They should show different size for customers so they know what to pick.
author: Connie H.

description: You can check-in to get a free miso with a purchase of your entree. Sometimes they run out of ingredients but most of the time they have the full menu. All their containers and utensils are compostable. Small, clean, and the portion size for the price is decent. Service is usually pretty good with some occasional slip ups (putting in wrong ingredients and forgetting the free miso soup). Overall, probably my favorite poke place in the neighborhood.
author: Bernice W.

description:
Yummy Yummy 

Went here with my friends. I ordered two scoops of salmon. Fish is very fresh. Friendly service. This place is very clean. Background music is enjoyable. 

Food 5/5 
Service 6/5
author: Jimmy H.

description: The fish is really fresh & tasty, and portions are generous.  Conveniently located at Park Merced next to SF State University.   I come here at least once a week.
author: Randy L.

description: Love the food here! especially the chicken bowl topped with seaweed, salad, corn, and tomato. Free miso soup after we checked in! Came here in the afternoon after class with my friend and the environment was nice and chill. The server was nice and kind. I would recommend my friends to come again next time.
author: Weimin C.

description: Yeah.. so my experience wasn't so good. The service.. there wasn't any really. Even when they handed the food to me, I didn't even notice cause they didn't say a word. Lots of silence. Then when I had my bowl with my friend, we both realized the rice was old. It was hard... so that was no good. The other ingredients were good though. Wasn't the best poke bowl because of the old rice & awkward atmosphere. Thus my 3 Stars.
author: Jei L.

description:
Stopped here for lunch, I was looking for something more on the healthy side. 
Cute little place with a parking lot and ample street parking. 
The place is really small, only has 3 tables with 8 chairs total for sitting so I would recommend doing take out. 
There are sheets by the entrance with pencils and you can custom order your poke bowl. 
I got a small salmon and spicy tuna with edamame, spicy mayo, seaweed salad, green onions, masago and dried garlic. It was so yummy! The fish tasted really fresh and the mayo was pretty good! Seaweed salad was on point and I loved the crunchiness of the dried garlic. 
I love that you can add as many sides and toppings for no additional costs. And there is a variety to choose from. You can also get white rice, brown rice or salad with the fish. 
Very good place for a healthy delicious meal!
author: Stephanie O.

description:
Yummy yummy. 
This is my favorite poke place in town, I love it so much. I ordered a chicken bowl with toppings: cherry tomatoes, corn, masago, and seaweed salad. I will definitely come back. The services is very good.
author: Janice Z.

description:
Poke kana is a unsuspecting poke place near sfsu. Came here with a friend because we wanted poke bowls, this place was actually decent. 

I got a regular bowl with salmon and tuna with spicy mayo/brown rice and all the toppings. I do have to say that this place has a pretty good rice to fish ratio. I actually had more fish than rice and I enjoyed that. The salmon and tuna tasted fresh but the spicy mayo sauce didn't taste spicy at all. The toppings were great and really made the bowl come together. I really like the ordering process where you mark down everything you want and you don't need to shout at the workers what exactly you want. 

If I am in the area again I really don't mind coming back here for another poke bowl. Plus parking is easy to find and there isn't much of a line. Then again I came at 530ish, kind of early for dinner. 

Total for 1: $13
author: Stella J.

description:
My husband and I went here for the first time, there was only one person working, who was very sweet and hard-working but she was overwhelmed with the amount of customers. More importantly about the food:
We have tried SO many poke places! 
This place has a really great option of hot bowls with chicken or beef or unagi(not a fan- better in sushi)

The regular pokey balls have very weird toppings that just don't mesh well. The imitation crab looked and tasted like carrots, and really didn't have what we usually find in a poke bowl. I wouldn't get this again. If I was starving and there was nothing else, yes I'd eat it again.
author: Hiba Z.

description: Cute little poke spot right by sf state. Came here after my night class and it forsure filled me up. Loved the atmosphere inside and the friendly staff as well. A good amount of options to choose from when it comes to making your own poke bowl, and the price is pretty decent too!
author: Monica-Leah A.

description:
I love this place! Service is fast and friendly and the food is fresh and plentiful!

Ordering is simple: you check off what you want on a small menu and they start assembling your order. I've ordered raw and cooked items and I've never waited more than 10 or so minutes. 

I've tried salmon and tuna poke in shoyu sauce and teriyaki sauce. I've also tried their thinly sliced beef option. Everything has been delicious and flavorful though I have a preference for salmon over tuna when it comes to poke. I also prefer the shoyu sauce over the teriyaki..I think I like teriyaki for cooked items more than raw ones. 

Every time I've gone here, they've been generous with their scoops of main dishes and side dishes. Since it's in a pretty convenient location for me, I would definitely order from there again!
author: Sofia R.

description:
Poke Kana is one of the few restaurants I visit on a weekly basis, and what keeps me coming back is the quality and consistency of the poke bowls. It also helps that the service is friendly, the restaurant is clean, and basically every part of your meal is compost-able (including the to-go trays and utensils).

What's odd is, I don't think I've ever written two positive yelp review updates for a restaurant I've visited, like I have for Poke Kana; generally speaking, I write a review update because my perspective has changed about that particular restaurant. But that's how good Poke Kana is; I only have good things to say about it.
author: Tyrone V.

description:
I needed a lunch break after studying at the nearby SFSU library and saw that this place had just opened. I walked into a tiny little spot, filled with a few tables and chairs, and a poke bar at the front where the person creates each bowl. There is paper and pencil right next to the door for each person to check off what they want in their poke bowl. I would imagine that this place may have customers lining up outside the door since the place is so small.

I hope this place makes a few changes, because I was not impressed at all. What's different about this place is that they put the rice and the poke next to each other in a to-go box. Usually the poke is on top of the rice. However, the presentation of it all put together looks quite appealing.

Don't be fooled, it looks better than it tastes.
I ordered: a small scoop of brown rice topped with seaweed salad, masago, green onion, avocado, mango, and corn
next to it was: tuna + salmon with spicy mayo mixed with carrots, edamame, onion and cucumber.

The brown rice was so dry and unappetizing. I took 2 bites and didn't bother eating the rest. The fish tasted fresh, yet bland even with the spicy mayo sauce tossed in. The sauce simply tasted like mayo with no flavor. The toppings made up for the lack of taste. However, paying $1 extra for avocado was not worth it. They gave me a few pieces, but I don't think it was enough to pay $1 extra for.

The bowl gives you enough food to satisfy your hunger, but I don't think it's worth paying a little over $10 for mediocre poke.
author: Rachelle Y.

description: Place looks nice, but the food does not match the decor. Did not taste fresh and they were out of ginger and wasabi. I would not go back.
author: Sergio S.

description:
Bar Rescue put this little known shopping plaza on the map. My friend would always suggest Park 77 (now The Lister), a college bar in the Parkmerced Plaza for us to meet up at. He was always adamant about going there and we always declined. "Y'all are missing out," he would tell us. 

After watching Bar Rescue...I found out what we were missing: porn. Apparently, some porn scenes took place at Park 77 (links to videos are NSFW): http://bit.ly/2aAurtB. Damn you, why didn't you just tell us this in the first place? 

Some "friend". 

*HUFFS*

I heard that a new poke eatery just opened up over the weekend, and after google mapping the address, I realized it was in Parkmerced Plaza near SFSU. The plaza can be very confusing to get to but Waze steered me in the correct direction. There's also a grocery store, Papa Murphy's, a taqueria, Hall of Flame Burgers (highly recommended), and The Lister in the plaza. 

Poke Kana is currently in their soft opening phase and is the newest BYO poke bowl eatery in San Francisco. Price is determined by the number of protein scoops: 2 - $8.99, 3 - $10.50, and 4 - $11.99. They have the same bases (white rice, brown rice, organic greens), fish (salmon, tuna, scallop, crab), sides (cucumber, corn, edamame, tofu, etc), sauces (shoyu, unagi, spicy mayo, etc) and toppings (wakame, onion, masago, sesame seeds, etc) like most other poke eateries. Avocado is +$1 but if you check-in on Yelp, it's free. Cc's accepted. 

I stopped by on my way home from bringing Tater Tot to the vet, and I ordered my usual that I do at other poke eateries, Salmon & Crab Poke Bowl w/ brown rice, all veggies, all toppings, spicy mayo (4 scoops protein - $11.99): http://bit.ly/2aFQlcz. 

: : P R O S ::
*Friendly employees. 
*Very clean. Didn't see cross-contamination issues with food bins. 
*Salmon was in large chunks, fresh, and buttery. 
*Veggies were fresh, crisp, and good quality. 
*Brown rice was properly cooked. 
*They use a two compartment, compostable containers so the warm rice and cold proteins don't touch! This is the first poke eatery in SF to use the two compartment containers. Yay, thank you! 
*No msg in the sauces, I usually have an msg reaction when I eat at nearby Poke Bowl (Daly City and Ocean Avenue).

: : C O N S ::
*Heavy handed with the sauces so request "light". 
*The protein-to-rice ratio was really off. In my pic, it may look like a huge portion but it was from the veggies and the shredded surimi. I had to fish for the salmon (they use a tiny ice cream scoop that fits like 2-3 chunks). They really need to beef up the amount of protein they provide.
*The crab was surimi, faux crab. It's counted as a protein but at other poke eateries, it's counted as a free topping. 
*Tiny portion of avocado: 3 small chunks. I would have been livid if I had to pay $1 for this. 
*Need to offer crunchy topping option like fried garlic or crushed macadamia nuts for some texture. 

Poke Kana has done a great job renovating the dry cleaning service that was previously here. There's only 3 two top tables but it's very contemporary, clean, and lots of natural lighting coming in from the windows.

There's easy parking in the private lot.

Poke Bar in the Twitter building is my current go-to favorite since I work nearby and they're generous with their proteins. Once Poke Kana works out their kinks and fix their small protein-to-rice ratio, they could easily rank in my top 5 poke eateries in SF.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
Dopalicious!! 

As we say in Giants territory - YES YES YES!!!

HELLA fresh fish. Excellent variety of sauces, high quality ingredients, small yet nice interior, feel good vibes. Scott, the owner is a personable fellow who creates a warm environment. 

Everything is prepared to order. Be patient. The food is worth the wait, though I agree with others - fish portions could be bigger. 

Official opening is August 18th and I know Poke Kana is going to thrive.

This place makes it easy to eat healthy.
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
New poke place around work, LUNCH TIME! YAY!

Wait, why two stars? 

This place is a bit expensive on how much you get compare to other places. Instead of a bowl, they give you one of those long square to-go boxes. The longer half is filled with the filter of your choice of white/brown rice or salad. Well, the other side is the sad part, portion is very small. Rice to fish ratio is terrible. I had so much rice left. Yes, their fish is good and fresh, but I only got 4 small square cubes for paying almost $10.00.

The girl up front wasn't very welcoming, only talk when asked.
author: Maria H.

description:
Went around 2PM and got brown rice with salmon, tuna, spicy tuna w/ light spicy mayo, avocado and a majority of the toppings. 

Pros:
-Really liked the mango! (prob because they're in season)
-Generous amount of toppings even though I chose almost every option
-Very cute and pretty interior design

Cons:
-My portion of poke was a bit small compared to SF expectations?

Small place, but it looks like they do try to provide as much seating arrangements as possible without overcrowding. Overall, if I was in the area, I would definitely try it again.
author: David C.

description: It was great quick lunch with kids. Healthy and light! Will definitely go back. Easy to park great service. Very attentive and polite staff.
author: Sabina A.

description: I love this place because I can write down anything of what I want. I got  two scoops of Salmon and tuna. They had a lot of toppings that you could choose from including Corn, seaweed salad, jalapeño, Masago, and onions. I got all of these. It was yummy and delicious. Also, you can CHECK IN on yelp to get a free miso soup. The food come out very fast and friendly service. I will definitely come back again!
author: Jjinyan Z.

description:
Poke Kana is my go to spot when it comes to poke. It is walking distance from campus so it's really convenient for anyone that goes to San Francisco State University. The poke here is outstanding, all ingredients in the bowl are fresh and the tastes are mouthwatering. The only con about this restaurant is seating availability it since it is so small but other than that you must try this place if you haven't already.

P.S- Make sure to check in to get a free miso soup!
author: Stevenson C.

description: Not a lot of seating, but I like coming for a quick bite.  Fresh ingredients and friendly staff.
author: C N.

description:
Pretty surprisingly solid poke place randomly hidden near San Francisco State! 

Really appreciate their checklist/ordering system because it makes things painless. I went with the spicy tuna and salmon and have no regrets, along with the brown rice. IF you check in on yelp. that's a free miso soup for you! I would definitely say that they should change the containers they serve their miso soup though, those biodegradable containers are definitely not meant to hold soup.
author: Andrew T.

description:
Stopped by this place around 4pm on a Tuesday and it was empty. Not surprised though, since 4pm isn't a typical meal time. 
I ordered a regular (3 scoops) to go and when I opened the lid, the portions were SO small. I almost thought I ordered a small (2 scoops) for a second because the portions were that tiny. There are definitely tons of other poke places that are well worth your money. 
The little food that they did give didn't taste bad though.
author: Susan P.

description:
The person who took my order wasn't much help describing anything on the menu.   And after my second time visiting, it's clear you have to babysit your order so they get it right.  My bowl was so bland despite my request for heavy sauce it was difficult to eat.  And yes, their scoop size as others have noted is a joke.  

I messaged this place on Facebook about my bad experience last week and I haven't heard back.  

Serving mediocre food and not paying attention to customer service seems like a poor way to run a business.  I hope the owner clues in as I live nearby and fish is an essential part of my diet--I really do want to like this place.
author: Sean H.

description:
I love poke and I was hesitant to try this place because of is location. The food places around here are ok but this place is pretty good!

The place is small but cute. Not really good for groups.

I ordered a large bowl with an extra scoop because I was sharing. We got 3 scoops salmon, one scallop, and one imitation crab.  I got a lot of veggies and a must is the fried garlic! So crunchy and full of flavor. Sauces I picked were the unagi, spicy mayo, and original! Good combo if you like sweet and creamy.
Total: $15 

Kind of pricy for poke! Places I've been to serve the same amount for around 10$ or less. And the scoops for the fish are kind of small. But I give it 5 stars because this place was surprisingly delicious!
author: Marilee A.

description: It's okay, no wait on a random weekday afternoon. The fish isn't as fresh as I'd like it to be, but the pro is generous amount of toppings.
author: Wendy L.

description: Good food. Love the convenience to walk to. Makes sure to check in for the complimentary miso soup.
author: Richard C.

description:
Average poke place located in the Park Merced neighborhood. It's good enough for local residents to satisfy their sushi/poke cravings. Put it this way...I'd visit Poke Kana as a SFSU student who wants a break from campus food. But if I'm an Ingelside or Sunset resident, I wouldn't make the trip.

I ordered had a three scoop bowl for $10.79. White rice, 2 scoops of salmon, 1 scoop scallop, and a bunch of miscellaneous toppings that I can't recall lol. I had light unagi sauce but I'd recommend ordering sauce on the side if possible so you may add as much as you desire. 

There's only three tables, not exactly a place to dine in. 

Check in for free miso soup!
author: Danae L.

description:
Poke Kane is the smallest i've seen, space and offering wise. just a counter, maybe a couple of tables. ordering is by checklist.

menu: 2 scoops(8.99) 3 scoops(10.5) 4 scoops(11.99base)
base: brown rice, white rice, greens
-proteins: scallop (out), tuna, spicy tuna, salmon, surimi (fake crab)
sides: carrot, cucumbers, onions.edamame, tofu
sauces,original shoyu, gluten free shoyu, wasabi shoyu spicy mayo, unagi, ponzu 
toppings: wakame, onion, masago, mango, sesame seeds,wasabi, cherry tomato, corn,jalepeno, ginger,  anago +1, pineapple +.75  avocado +1

eats: 2 scoops(8.99) with brown rice,, tuna, salmon, cucumbr, onions, edmame, unagi sauce, wakame, onion, masago, manga, sesame seed. not extras.
-came in dividor pak, lots of brown rice, few of rest of pickings, noticed mixing going on, still flavorless, unagi must be too deliicate..

take outs:
-disappoitment, not filing,  wakame missing, got sprivng leaves instead.
--got miso soup on check-in, just miso flavored broth
-2ish stars . doubtful repeat too few choices, porions small.
-lots of parking.
author: Victor G.

description:
Definitely a stickler when it comes to fresh fish and Poke Kana does it right. Not only does Poke Kana have a quaint but modern shop, their customer service skills are great as well. I visited them on a Tuesday right after opening and was assisted by who I can assume was the manager. He was very helpful and offered his assistance if I had any questions about the menu.

I opted for the three scoops of fish with the works. One scoop spicy tuna, two scoops salmon. The fish was amazingly fresh and smooooth like butta! Not stringy at all and chopped in similar sizes, unlike other poke shops. They definitely put out their products with love and consistency. The three scoop choice came with salad and brown rice (you can choose one or the other, I chose 1/2 and 1/2). I also chose to put green onions, ginger, cucumber, asago and onions topped with the spicy mayo sauce - came out to about $13, and a free miso soup with check in.

I love that Poke Kana uses compostable to-go containers and compostable utensils as well. Their shop is brand new and soooo cute. Bottom line, go!
author: Kathleene E.

description: This is my favorite place for poke. I ordered three scoops of tuna, spicy tuna, and cooked shrimp with spicy Mayo sauce. Fish is very fresh and spicy tuna is so good. I love it so much. Friendly service. Will come back again!
author: Chloe Z.

description: Decent sized bowls. I like that you can pick and choose the accoutrements for your poke bowl. I had the salmon and I have to say that I actually make this better at home, but considering I'm out and about, it's not a bad alternative. Only reason why I didn't give this place a 5 Star, is that it's too small of a place and they don't provide complimentary water for people who want to dine-in. Otherwise, it's pretty good.
author: Jovi W.

description:
Fast friendly service. Honestly, its one of the better poke places around this area so far for me. 

Miso Soup - you can get a free miso soup with check-in and claim it on yelp. Although very simple, miso soup was pretty good. Not salty but good amount of flavor. 

Now to the good stuff the Poke Bowl itself. 
The poke bowl was really good. 
- Fresh!
      - got 3 scoops. 2 of salmon and 1 tuna
- Lots of options for toppings
- Sauce is really good too. I got the spicy mayo with mine. 

Only weird thing was I'm used to the poke being served on top the rice, but they have it on the side. Other than that if you're looking for something quick and delicious, this is the place for you!
author: Sunny P.

description: i was excited to try this place because of all the reviews i saw but i was very disappointed after finishing my meal. my bf and i came here and got the small bowl which had two scoops of protein. i got the salmon and crab meat with white rice and some other regular toppings. you mark off what you want on their menu and then hand it to them. it took them about 10 minutes to make two bowls and i thought that was a little slow knowing that they already had our order right in front of them. i've worked in a poke restaurant before so i know how long it should take. when i got my bowl, i already noticed my rice LOOKED hard and when i ate a bite, it was definitely hard. it was warm hard rice which i didn't know was possible.. usually the crab meat is scooped on but here, they mix it with the other protein and i felt like they did that because they wanted to mask how much they actually give you. all my protein just looked like one mini scoop. the other toppings were okay? but they skimp on the sauce so much!! i did check in for a miso soup and jt was kinda salty and felt like it was in the pot for too long cause the seaweed was very mushy. can't really complain cause it was free but i am complaining ha ha ha. the fish wasn't really that fresh. i don't think i will be coming back here.
author: diane d.

description:
Their portions are meager and service subpar. Placing your index finger and thumb together presents an accurate representation of what a "scoop" is. The cashier doubles as your server which she (in my case) hardly excels at. Unfortunately the fish quality was nothing worth nothing. 

2 stars for effort.
author: Alan N.

description: I like this place because they are generous with the poke portions and there are a lot of options. It's very fresh and delicious. It's also close to home so it's very convenient.
author: Y B.

description: A decent clean place with a couple of tables for those who want to eat in.  The owner was serving, I know BC I recognized  him  from Yelp. Nice uniforms on the staff. Easy to understand instructions, decide on how many scoops, rice, sides n toppings.  3 scoops cost $10.99, a reasonable price, compared to others.  Fish seems fresh. Will go back!
author: Elaine Y.

description:
The only reason to give this poke restaurant a rating higher than a 3 would be the super sweet girl that works there and the cute simplistic decor. Take that away though, and sadly, I wouldn't be coming back.

Rice seemed a bit stale, the fish did not taste super fresh, and the sauce (I got the wasabi shoyu) was kind of... "meh." 

Digging the music they play though.
author: Cathy C.

description:
I came here with a friend the other day for dinner. It's a pretty quiet area and we were the only customers, but the staff was really nice. I like the paper menu where you can place your order -- it gives you time to think and makes the selection process so much less confusing, especially for a poke first-timer like my friend.

We spent about $11 each on 3 scoops of fish and avocado, which is normally $1 extra, but we split the Yelp check-in free avocado discount. It looks small, but is pretty filling.

The poke itself was okay. I got the ahi tuna and it didn't taste as fresh as other poke I've had. My friend got the salmon and had an upset stomach all night. :(
author: Stephanie H.

description:
The portions are pretty generous and on the separate occasions I've gone, they offered miso soup if you checked in. Not sure if that's still an incentive. Anyways, it's a good go to poke place, although there's so many in the bay area now. 

The location is clean and convenient. The only small qualm I have is their serving "box" has two compartments but that's just a preference thing.
author: Jessica Z.

description: It does the job well enough to come back to. If you are looking for the best poke bowl around, don't get your hopes up. It does do the job, not gonna lie. But,  meh it's  standard. I'm not blown away with it like at other places. The staff was friendly, the area was clean. You can't so groups here but it's decent on the go for class. Super convenient for students.
author: Ann N.

description:
As someone who is from Hawaii and enjoys fresh poke (raw fish) on a daily basis,
the quality of the fish here and the portions for the price are amazing. Also having this specific type of restaurant here in parkmerced is God-sent. 

The combination options are a great variation and the palette is simplistic. Quality of food is awesome. The restaurant is clean and has a sophisticated/causal dining atmosphere. Thanks for coming to parkmerced Poke Kana
author: K. J.

description: This place is a great find! I stumbled on this place while doing laundry with the hubby. The lady who helped us is very friendly and pleasant to deal with. It's more of an eat and go type of spot or get your food to go. A must try if you're in this area.
author: Sheila G.

description:
A bit higher priced for what it is than others I've had. Service was nice, but slow (and there wasn't even a line!)

The fish was fresh and flavors were good.  Not as many options as other poke places I've been. Maybe I'm spoiled... 

Checking in on yelp gave me a free miso which was awesome.

Downside of this place is that it's SMALL. Only three very small tables, so don't plan on coming with any kind of group. One or two people or take it to go.
author: Angela C.

description:
Got there at 8 pm at night. The place was quite with a worker waiting for costumer behind the counter. 

As you walk you on your left side are instructions on how to order your poke bowl. 

Once desire food is marked off on menu, you hand it off to the guy behind the counter. He constructs your master piece. 

You have the option to eat at one of their three take, with a great atmosphere or you can pay 20 cent for a paper bag and take it to go. 

Upon opening my treasure box of goodness, the worker was nice enough to write down what I order on the box with a happy face :) so i wouldn't be confused with some of the other things I got. 

I enjoy the place, and would come back the next time I visit my friend.
author: Fran C.

description: Small place in the most unexpected location.  Food is average and service is so-so.  I wouldn't drive out for this but is an acceptable neighborhood spot.
author: Enzo M.

description:
Poke Kana...

Walking into this little store was pretty descent because one it is clean and has very simple decor. There are only three tables which are nice because this one table can allow you to hook on any bags.

The price overall was pretty descent cause it is pretty affordable! I ordered the three poke which was $10.95 plus tax, but that was a big portion believe me! I loved it and what I liked about it was that when you choose your sauce you can either have it light or heavy which is good thing when choosing. I was a little upset that they didn't have scallops and I think that they should have posted it on their daily board to let people know. Also being a Yelper, you are able to get a free miso soup when checking in! lols

Customer service was overall great and would definitely like to come back here!

Btw all there utensils and boxes are all compostable which is a great thing to have!
author: Brittany L.

description: Excellent Service from lady with glasses!!! We had spicy tuna salmon crab meat mix veggie sea weed salad and seasoning... love the spicy tuna here !!!
author: Nacho E.

description: It's bomb! I'm mad I just found out about it! I'll crave sushi really bad but there aren't any sushi places near so Poke is the next best thing!
author: Jasmin C.

description: Really good go here all the time. Plus the free soup with  yelp check in is nice. They stopped serving mango and are are out of things often such as salmon and avocado.
author: Megan E.

description: This place is fairly new. The poke and service was good when it first opened. Now both of these area's have come down.  They are very conservative on the toppings. Had to request a few times to a normal portion.  Also the salmon smelled and did not taste fresh.  On top of that, the service was poor.  The employee wasnt even trying. I recommend not going here. There are much better locations in San francisco for good Poke.
author: Mase S.

description:
Great food, nice service and very clean, I got the Unagi bowl and it was Yummy!!! So flavorful, and a good size portion and a very reasonable price. I would go back for sure.

The only small issue was that all the food is served in plastic, which is fine because its a small place and lots of people take "to go". When I asked where to throw away the plastic container, it went in the regular garbage which was filled with plastic,

Please recycle, save the earth. This is a fish restaurant but out oceans are now filled with plastic,
author: diana b.

description: Poke kana is yummy, tried their poke bowl with salmon and spicy tuna, mix with everything and white rice. It tastes fresh and the people who made it were friendly. Located in small plaza and there was a few other options around like: mexican, chinese (northern with boba), papa johns and an american burger.
author: Bai Z.

description:
Had the tuna bowl. The food seemed pretty healthy lots of vegetable not so much the fish though. The place was small and clean. 
The bad:  
It was $11, a bit pricey for the portion. The food was ok, nothing special. The worst part is I got a stomachache after eating it. I don't know about the other bowls but the tuna was definitely not fresh. I had to skip my class after eating at this place because of my stomachache! Worst place to get raw food. Here's an advice: DO NOT GO HERE if you have class or plans after eating. There is a chance that you will have to cancel whatever plans you have.
author: Vincent G.

description:
I'm not reviewing the place as I took my food to go, but as for the food, it is pretty good. I ordered the imitation crab with unagi sauce topped with seaweed salad, green onion, sesame seeds, and avocado. Avocado is an extra $1, of course. Overall, the protein to rice ratio was good, but I wish they didn't skimp on the toppings. I didn't get a lot of seaweed salad as I had hoped. As for the avocado, looking at the portion size, it wasn't too reasonable either. Also, I checked in on Yelp and received a free miso soup, which was a pretty good size considering it was free and had a lot of tofu and seaweed in it, yet lacked flavor in my opinion. 

Nevertheless, I would come back considering it's definitely better than Poke Bowl in terms of taste and it is right next to SFSU. 

Also, I want to give them kudos for their food containers, as they separate protein and rice, and are compostable!
author: Jia A.

description:
Very good price for the portion of the food. The salmon was SO fresh and the the girl who was working was very sweet. 

+ You get to choose if you want light or heavy sauce which I love! 
- For the crab meat, I like when it's mixed with mayo but here, it's just shredded imitation crab meat w/o any sauce mixed with it

Private parking lot and good topping options!
author: Kailey C.

description: Literally the best poke bowl I've ever had, especially their unagi don, only 11 bucks with huge unagi portion, and it tastes pretty descent. Convenient location with compostable utencils, and the owner guy is pretty nice and friendly.
author: Lucy F.

description:
Had a bowl with white rice, double salmon, tuna, and spicy tuna.  The rice was not seasoned and a little warm for my liking (I could feel thr heat through the bottom of the to go container, seasoned sushi rice is better suited for poke).  Portion size seemed ok if not a little on the small side..  

I got my bowl with shoyu Sauce and yuzu and it was fine but nothing to write home about.  

Now I dont have a sensitive stomach or anything but I did get sick that night, not fun.  I do understand the risk when eating raw fish so you cant get too mad.  They do have to use frozen fish to keep the cost down

I'll probably try again in a month or two to see how this place develops
author: Aaron E.

description: This place is the new cool kid on the block. Clean welcoming interior and friendly service. Had the brown rice with salmon,tuna and spicy tuna, with the special wasabi soyu sauce,hmm..  The fish were as fresh as it can get. I highly recommend the spicy tuna.  I will definitely stop by again to try out other sauce ad well. One more thing,I noticed they use all biodegradable boxes and utensils,thumb up for that.
author: Neo C.

description:
Hm I hate leaving negative comments (especially about fish) but this place did not meet the expectation of 4 stars. Sadly, the fish was not as fresh as it perhaps could have been. I chose the gluten free shoyu sauce and the spicy mayo sauce. I'm not sure if it was the combination of the two together or if they were individually the problem, but I really didn't like the taste of them. The spicy mayo reminded me of a faint thousand island dressing that was not very appetizing. I also got a scoop of salmon and tuna. The sauce was so overpowering that it masked the taste of the fish. 

It seems like the place is still fairly new and can work to master their flavors. I probably won't be back to try it. 

I also strongly recommend they invest in window blinds. Depending on the time of day, it gets pretty warm from the blistering sunlight that shoots directly into the store. I'm sure this is bound to affect the temperature of the food regardless of its refrigeration storage.

To end on a positive, I loved the simple and minimalistic decor in the small little restaurant. Very cute.
author: Diana K.

description: Wow. Freshest fish around. Reasonable prices, plenty of parking. I will be back again
author: N G.

description: They have a system where you fill out what you want then hand them the paper. Despite this...they still managed to give me the wrong fish )= So to be safe...I would suggest just watching the workers prepare your meals to avoid any mistakes! The portions here are pretty small and I did not like how they separated the fish from the rice, as well as all the sides. All of the sauce was on the side leaving the rice all dry and alone )'= HENCE! I also suggest asking them to possibly just place the fish directly on top of the rice in order for the sauce flavors to soak into the rice...ya know? But if you're in a rush and happen to be in the area, this is def a great healthy choice!
author: Mary L.

description: This is a nice place to grab Poke at if you're around the area and craving some.. But otherwise if you're able to go somewhere else, there are ton of other Poke places. Good workers with a clean/cute space, but definitely not worth the money with how small the portions are. They give u 4/5 pieces of whichever protein you choose and fill in the rest of the space in the box with unnecessary big portions of carrots/cucumbers/edamame. 3 stars because it's a decent Poke place near my home, but I wouldn't make this my go-to.
author: Michelle L.

description: Great food, great atmosphere, tiny and not a lot of seating. Super friendly people who work there, but they need to have descriptions of the ingredients up on the wall or something! I can see this business being successful once they work out some of those "opening" kinks!
author: Davinah S.

description: This place is located in a mini shopping mall. The environment is very relaxing and peaceful. They had music in the background is I was jamming to it. They brought back old music that were from the 2000s. The food was okay. The portion was great. They had great service too. I ordered two scoops with imitation crab, 1/2 spicy tuna, 1/2 salmon, seaweed salad, mangoes, masago, and bonito flake. I didn't love the imitation crab at all. From all the other poke places I've been, this store had the WORST imitation crab. If you don't like fishy smell at all, I don't recommend getting bonito flake. I also ordered a coconut. It wasn't too expensive for it. Although the drink was great, I wished they could've opened it better for me; they broke my coconut and it starting leaking. If you check in on yelp, make sure to grab the miso soup because they will try to play you and not get it for you. Their service was great because my friend was vegan and they had great options for vegans. When my friend didn't choose any protein, they walked up to our table to ask her if she wanted any protein to double check her order. When they're finished making your order, they will personally bring your food to you. The biggest surprise I had was the mangos. This place is the first place that serves mangos as part of your meal.
author: Dominique C.

description:
Came just now, ordered food, and the girl working told me customers can't use their bathroom, and that I need to use the bathroom at the coffee shop

I'm pretty sure restaurants required to have restroom arrangements for guests, and telling us to use another business' bathroom is illegal.

she also hangs out in the back and I had to wait a few minutes to place an order
author: Mark M.

description: Although I haven't personally been to Hawaii and tried the real stuff, I would say I've eaten at many poke places and can tell which ones are just not it...this was not it. The rice is hard and the fish doesn't taste fresh. They give more toppings to make up for the lack of fish. Definitely not up to standards. Also, don't come on a hot or busy day, you will burn inside since there's no air conditioning.
author: Ashley Y.

description: Food is pretty good, but it shouldn't take over 20 minutes for the food to come out after you've ordered it.  No explanation on why a poke bowl would take so long...the cashier didn't even provide any updates on the status of the order.
author: Craig L.

description: Unagi Don was amazing! Had a poke bowl also and was very good. Fresh ingredients you can taste. Friendly staff in a clean environment. Wish the space was a bit bigger, but it's more geared towards togo orders. Pick up and go, quick and easy meal, on the light and healthy side. A+
author: David L.

description: Favorite poke spot in the area. Yes, its a little small, but the food is of great quality. The staff is incredible as well.  While their poke is great, I recommend their Unagi Don. If it's ever too crowded there, take your food to the bar next door (:
author: Angelica F.

description:
Visiting from Sacramento area. While on the road I like to find light and healthy places to eat. This place was perfect. The portions were delicious and filling and give you energy instead of making you tired. I wish there was one of these closer to home. 

Service was helpful and guided us through the menu as this was our first visit.
author: Martin C.

description: I'm really glad this place opened. This is a random, sort of depressing strip mall but the Tacqueria, Burger place, and now Poke Kana are all really good. Poke Kana is definitely the healthiest of all the options. I've been twice now and the food is fresh, colorful and flavorful. My only wish is that o could get a meal for around $10, but even the smallest Poke serving and no drink comes out to be about $12. Other than that, I really like it here!
author: Miss M.

description: This is probably one of my favorite poke place in the city. The service was good and friendly. I got the salmon and tuna with spicy mayo. Very flavorful and delicious. Fish tasted fresh and was very full from one bowl. Will definitely come back.
author: Peter N.

description: I like the food here! It is a good place to get lunch after class;) just five mins walk from library!!! The staffs are friendly and awesome.
author: Jing W.

description: The poke itself was decent, but the taste was a little odd to me. And I didn't like how they mixed the crab meat up along with the other fish, sauce and some of the toppings. It made everything into a big mush. I'm used to places putting the crab meat on top of the rice on the side, not intermixed. And the rice so just sooooo dry. Especially when putting on a paper to go container, which absorbs even more of the moisture from the food. Very disappointed with this place.
author: Desiree V.

description: Soooo delicious! Everything tastes super fresh here, and the staff is very friendly and helpful to top it all off! Plus it's a short walk from SFSU, so it's very convenient to come for lunch. I definitely will be a returning here soon!
author: Jessica Q.

description: I officially LOVE this place. Super delicious food if you like sushi. Also not expensive.
author: Zack S.

description: Small places with casual atmosphere. Nice to hang out with friends. I can create my own combination.
author: Jay C.

description: I'm a big fan of poki, so I was pretty excited that they opened this place up so close to school. The place is decorated super cute- minimal, inviting and clean. However, I was not a fan of the food. Right away, it came out really presentable and appetizing, and for a little over $10 for its portion size, I was not discontent yet. What was truly disappointing for me though, was the taste of the food. I thought it was weird that the rice was piping hot and the fish was cold at the same time. Maybe that's a snobby thing to say, but I never realized before that the temperatures of all parts of a poki bowl were the same in previous experiences- and it made a big difference this time. My mouth was trying to find a balance between the two. I tried to shrug it off, but then I realized that the fish was just not good. I couldn't tell whether it was because it was not fresh or because it tasted bland, even with the sauce on top and all the other ingredients with it. I ended up feeling nauseous after my meal, too... so sad.
author: Sarah L.

description:
I am a huge fan of restaurants that have good food and great service, and this place was it.
I came in right when they opened and both the workers had a great attitude. They thoroughly explained the menu to me, explaining what sizes get how many scoops of fish.
I ended up getting the regular size poke bowl. I got 2 scoops of salmon and 1 scoop of spicy tuna. Of course I asked for extra seaweed salad. It was amazing! I loved how it wasn't overpowered with too much sauce like other places. I tried the original shoyu with the spicy mayo. It was soooo good. I wish it was in a bowl container inside of the container it comes in because it gets kind of hard to mix the rice and the rest of the poke. 
I checked in to get a free miso soup!
One thing that really stood out to me about this place was that all their to go containers and utensils were biodegradable. I love a restaurant that goes out of their way to keep our environment clean.
Way to go Poke Kana, will be coming back again when need for a poke craving satisfaction!
author: Ariunaa B.

description: I love this place. It's probably one of the better ones on this area (ocean ave). I would definitely check it out again. :)
author: Marvin A.

description: Love everything about this place. Fish is super fresh, all the ingredients are super fresh, decent portions, super nice staff, nice clean place to eat inside. Some of my favorite poke in the city!
author: Solon B.

description: Im glad there is poke place open near me. I definitely give them 5 stars. I work as a chec
author: Zula H.

description: The food and atmosphere created in such a small venue is actually a pleasant surprise. Price is a little high for the small portions but, the taste is something I will be coming back for. Free miso soup when you check in as well.
author: Vincent C.

description: Small portions as stated before. I feel like the other reviews are bs, probably endorsed by Poke Kana themselves. Bad vibes overall, avoid.
author: Nina I.

description: Whatever you do, just don't order delivery from here. I was seduced by all the positive tales of fresh fish, and unfortunately had the opposite experience. Not sure if it was because it was towards the end of the day, but the fish was not fresh, and several pieces were totally inedible. To top it off, they will only let you order very limited options for delivery, and you can't pick either the protein or the toppings, and the bowls that we got came with NO SAUCE. It was the worst poke I've ever had, period.
author: Sushi M.

description: Big portions for a great price! The place is very well kept & clean .. Not to mention right around my neighborhood! People need to come here more! Fish is fresh and definitely plenty
author: Anne C.

description: The vibe of the store is very cute. Really good price for poke and servings are pretty generous. Definitely would come back.
author: Natalie L.

description: Pretty stoked about this poke spot! I've tried a few others around the city and wasn't really impressed, but this one really got me. Their bowls are a little over $11 and unlike other poke spots, they give you a decent amount of fish. The restaurant is clean and hip. In addition to the heap of raw fish, the great service really sets this spot apart from other poke shops.
author: Raquel S.

description: Went to this place two days straight. Food was fresh and good! My only complaint is the food portions.... My first day I came the portions was Great and hearty. Lots of fish and veggies. The 2nd day there was barely any salmon and tuna when I ordered the 3 scoops. (Both days ordered the exact same thing). I had like 1 cherry tomato when the other day there's was like 6... *i love tomatoes* but yea. The 2nd day was like dam what happened???!!!  There portions should be more consistent. For a new business to attract more customers and existing ones they should have good hearty portions for their customers to be happy! That's my only issue. Other than that good place.
author: Dong H.

description:
I feel entirely misled by the reviews of this place! I ordered a veggie bowl with brown rice and shoyu sauce. The miso soup was room temperature. The bowl itself had really dry brown rice (not the sticky kind but long grain). Really subpar. 
Would think twice before coming here.
author: Jacklyn L.

description: This was an exceptional light dinner. I tried the spicy tuna and scallops, with a nice mix of toppings. All ingredients were very fresh. Also, they were very friendly providing help to those that needed it when ordering. The place is mainly designed as take out, however it has a few small tables. We will definitely be frequenting this place.
author: Gabriel V.

description:
I came here with my sister for the first time earlier.
It's way more filling than sushi and unique. It was well worth the great price. 
Great food, great proportions, and great staff as well!
author: Tia P.

description: Nice Hawaiian style Poke bowls.  It's a build-your-own bowl based on a menu of options.  The tuna was quite good.  The miso soup tasted fresh.  Small eat-in area decorated with selections of IKEA furniture & accessories.  Recyclable/compostable take out cutlery & containers.  Expect to spend about $10 for a meal with beverage.
author: Judith B.

description: Great place!! Always fresh and tasty!! Good prices and rarely a wait! Makes me feel healthier for ordering it!
author: Sarah K.

description: I came across this place after my run around Lake Merced. I ordered the 2 scoops of fish salad bowl, The fish is very fresh, both tuna and salmon with the spicy mayo sauce, portions wise might be a little small but considering how much I paid and the quality I got from it is way worth more than the others I have tried. Their miso soup is also great, taste like homemade, I could tell it didn't contain any MSG in it and also in low sodium.
author: HappyFridays H.

description: Grabbed some food for an early dinner.  Food was awesome.  Staff was nice.  Small place with 3 tables and 7 chairs.  Looks like it caters for a to go business..  Everything is served in compostable containers.   May go back tomorrow as it was that good.
author: josh D.

description: This place is so expensive! I paid $ 11 for tiny plastic container and when I came home and opened it it was scoop of salad and 2 tiny pieces of fish! And it locates between 'Dos Charros" and "Hall of flame" where you can buy real good salad in big container! Never again!
author: Sonia Y.

description: Food is good and fast but don't buy drinks there and forget. I paid for my $.99 Arizona drink and forgot it. I go there often and figure I could pick it up next time I'm there. No luck. Really $.99 and they gave me a hard time. Oh well.....they just lost a customer for $.99
author: Cuong P.

description: Wish this place was better because it's so close for me. My main issue is the rice is hot! I don't know if it's just me but hot rice and raw fish does not go together at all.
author: Kira N.

description: I guess I have bad luck with this place! Small portions for the price , too much carrots and not too much rice and fish!
author: Sofia F.

description: This place was pretty bad. The fish wasn't fresh at all. As a poki place, you're biggest objective should be ensuring that you are serving fresh fish and this just did not meet the standards. It gave my girlfriend and I pretty bad stomach aches. We won't be coming back.
author: Andrew D.

description: I literally created a yelp profile just to leave Poke Kana a review. I am an avid poke eater and always love trying new spots around the city. Currently, I'a Poke is my go-to when I get the craving, however that might be changing soon! Right off the bat, once I walked into Poke Kana I was greeted by a worker and made small talk with me. He waited patiently for me to fill out my form, rang me up for my bowl (that totaled a little above 11 dollars) and promptly began making my bowl. Contrary to other reviews, the portions of fish and veggies were very generous. My bowl was prepared quickly and had a very nice aesthetic. I walked out a very happy customer. Compared to other poke places around the city and in DC I think the prices are very fair for the quality of fish and abundance of food I was given. The only reason Im reluctant to give 5 stars is because they're brand new and I think theres always room for improvement! I'll definitely be back soon.
author: Laurel H.

description: Small poke shop in a location nearby to Uhaul; this place grabbed my attention as I was returning my rental to the Cambon Drive Uhaul, and thinking about a fast bite of food. There was no line when I arrived, however the order protocol and staff seem to be efficient enough to handle some volume during peak hours. My order consisted of a rice bowl with four scoops of spicy tuna, avocado, and some toppings and sauces, plus a bottle of water, which came to $15. Having worked in a big city it seems on par the cost of a nice lunch, generally. I recognized most of the ingredients from patronage of another poke shop. The raw tuna was diced small, stirred into the chili and sauces, and served a bit below room temperature. The temperature of the raw fish seemed appetizing, yet sufficiently chilled for safe handling. Great experience, and I will be back when I am I the area and looking for a fast, tasty poke meal.
author: Justin B.
